summary: Dependable licensed master's of social work (LMSW) and Certified Care Manager (CMC) trained in multiple healthcare environments with broad range of client populations (pediatrics through geriatrics). Experience with a multitude of social work related situations such as dementia care, inpatient and outpatient, crisis management, etc. Currently working as the social worker and dementia care assistant on the Alzheimer's and Dementia Care (ADC) Program through the Geriatrics and Palliative Medicine Office at Northwell Health.

currentPositions.description:
An expanded, combined social work position at Northwell Health Physician Partners Geriatrics and Palliative Medicine at New Hyde Park and at Feinstein Institutes of Health System Science.

Alzheimer's and Dementia Care (ADC) Program at Northwell Health
Part of adopting site of UCLA/John A. Hartford Foundation ADC Program
currentPositions.title: Geriatric Social Worker and Researcher

headline: Geriatric Social Worker and Researcher

certifications.authority: National Academy of Certified Care Managers
certifications.name: Certified Care Manager

publications.description:
Key Points
Question  Can an advance care planning (ACP) video and communication intervention promote ACP for elderly patients during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic?

Findings  This pre-post, open-cohort nonrandomized controlled trial compared ACP documentation during three 6-month periods: pre–COVID-19 (14 107 patients), COVID-19 wave 1 (12 806 patients), and an intervention period (15 106 patients). The ACP documentation rates were 17.9% in the pre–COVID-19 period, 12.5% in the COVID-19 wave 1 period, and 23.7% in the intervention period; ACP rates during the intervention period were highest compared with the 2 other periods.

Meaning  The use of an ACP video and communication intervention may promote ACP for elderly adults during the evolving COVID-19 pandemic.
publications.name: Association of an Advance Care Planning Video and Communication Intervention With Documentation of Advance Care Planning Among Older Adults A Nonrandomized Controlled Trial

message.text:
What an incredible week of not one but TWO honors for my work in dementia care! 

Starting out as one of the Long Island Alzheimer’s and Dementia Center’s ‘Here’s to Hope’ luncheon honorees (Tori Cohen) and then receiving the ‘Young Researcher’ Award through The Feinstein Institutes and A Gentle Touch Home Care (Patrick Ryan), I am so grateful to work in a community that promotes caring for those living with dementia, their caregivers as well as advancing much needed research in the field of Alzheimer’s and dementia care💜

Thank you to all who continuously support me as I grow in my social work career and our work through the Alzheimer’s and Dementia Care Program at Northwell Health Geriatrics and Palliative Medicine Practice at New Hyde Park!

commentary.text: I am incredibly grateful for these honors and to get to work in a field with the amazing people who support families living with dementia as well as advancing much needed research for dementia care 💜
